posts.message:
Guys i have developed this Android application years ago and now the project is on Github if anyone interested to contribute in the app here is the link :) 

** https://github.com/mhussien86/Etmasakt

App name : is Etmasakt 
App Description : According to revolutions in the middle east (Egypt,Syria,Yemen...), it was needed to make such an application to help the people who defending their rights and got arrested by the police or the army , this application helps you to send SMS to multi numbers (family , lawyer , activists....etc ) + sending the address of place where you got arrested in, to alert people with just one click and be safe.
Kindly note that you have to enable GPS in order to get accurate location.

Feel free to contact me :)

For Linux geeks:
I saw people here (especially Islam Gad) talking about Elementary linux distro

So I checked it out and it's amazing...

I'm not really a linux expert but I'm trying to get used to Ubuntu and when I read about Elementary they said it's based on Ubuntu

so can you please tell me what it's pros and cons ?

Is it ready to be used on daily basis to do heavy work

Is Freya stable enough or what exactly ? I just want to know what do you think about it overall

Thanks a lot

And in case some of you doesn't know about it here's a video:

posts.description: ==So...elementary OS Freya. What do you think about it? Revolutionary or incremental?== I take out the stops and review the latest elementary OS release 0.3 ...

PEP 8 is Python style guide. Style guides are good, but they are not enough to make you write maintainable code.

This session discuss this. Although the context is about Python, Python style guide (PEP 8), Pythonic (beautiful) code, you can learn how to appreciate maintainable code in any language.

On a related note, the yearly Python conference has many interesting sessions about many topics: performance, machine learning, home automation, scientific computing, etc. You'll find all of these videos in the same YouTube account which uploaded this video.

Emad Mokhtar Habib you'll like it
posts.caption: youtube.com
posts.description: "Speaker: Raymond Hettinger Distillation of knowledge gained from a decade of Python consulting, Python training, code reviews, and serving as a core develop...
